result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tevin Marquis Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tevin Marquis Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Tevin Marquis Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel has offer and discovery and requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tevin Marquis Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Tevin Marquis Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial date to meet with defendant. Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DAP.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Tevin Marquis Smith in court.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 41 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Tevin Marquis Smith
Current: 10421 W Sheridan Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53225 United States  (Effective: 07-06-2022)
Prior: 8303 West Bobolink Avenue, #2, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Tevin Marquis Smith not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 9/1/22 @ 1p
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
